spacecraft.name: Chandrayaan-2 Orbiter, Vikram Lander, Pragyan Rover

objectives: To demonstrate the key technologies for end-to-end lunar mission capabilities, including soft-landing and roving on the lunar surface.

To expand the lunar scientific knowledge through detailed study of topography, seismography, mineral identification and distribution, surface chemical composition, thermo-physical characteristics of top soil and composition of the tenuous lunar atmosphere.

payloads.name: Terrain Mapping Camera 2 (TMC-2)
payloads.purpose: To create a high-resolution 3D map of the lunar surface.

payloads.name: Chandraâ€™s Atmospheric Composition Explorer 2 (CHACE-2)
payloads.purpose: To study the composition of the tenuous lunar exosphere.

payloads.name: Alpha Particle X-ray Spectrometer (APXS)
payloads.purpose: To determine the elemental composition of the lunar surface near the landing site.

outcome.summary: The orbiter was successfully deployed and continues to study the Moon. However, communication was lost with the Vikram lander during its final descent, and it crash-landed on the lunar surface. The mission is considered a partial success.
